binary_inputs.name: Abnormal Operator Settings
binary_inputs.description: This flag shows that the operator has the ACR in an abnormal state such as “work tag applied”. This means that it will operate differently to its normal mode of operation.

binary_inputs.name: ACR Tripped (open)
binary_inputs.description: These are repeats of the mechanism travel switches. When the ACR is disconnected from the control cubicle they are both cleared.

binary_inputs.name: ACR Closed
binary_inputs.description: These are repeats of the mechanism travel switches. When the ACR is disconnected from the control cubicle they are both cleared.

binary_inputs.name: Controller Mode
binary_inputs.description: The controller is either in LOCAL or Remote Controller Mode. This affects the closing command the permission to set/remove work tag.

binary_inputs.name: Maintenance Required
binary_inputs.description: The controller has detected one or more conditions which require maintenance. This point cannot become Set until at least five minutes after controller start.

binary_inputs.name: Work Tag
binary_inputs.description: The controller can have a work tag. This affects the closing command

binary_inputs.name: Prot A Active
binary_inputs.description: Only one protection group is active at any one time.

binary_inputs.name: Prot B Active
binary_inputs.description: Only one protection group is active at any one time.

binary_inputs.name: Earth / Ground Protection Enabled
binary_inputs.description: 500ms

binary_inputs.name: SEF/SGF Protection Enabled
binary_inputs.description: 500ms

binary_inputs.name: Auto Reclose
binary_inputs.description: 500ms

binary_inputs.name: Loss of Phase Protection
binary_inputs.description: 500ms

binary_inputs.name: Protection enable
binary_inputs.description: 500ms

binary_inputs.name: Power Flow Direction (Source and Load Bushings)
binary_inputs.description: The power flow direction (source/load designation) is determined by the user. Refer to the Power Flow Direction binary output for more information

binary_inputs.name: Protection Data Valid
binary_inputs.description: This shows that the protection sequence is over and the other flags are set. This could be used to drive an operator alarm at the SCADA system to alert him to the fact that a protection sequence has occurred. Note that operator trip alone does not cause a "protection data valid" Event time is the time of lockout or reclaim.

binary_inputs.name: Operator Trip
binary_inputs.description: One flag only because operator trip forces lockout. Event time is the time of the trip

binary_inputs.name: Phase Over Current Trip
binary_inputs.description: 10ms

binary_inputs.name: Earth / Ground Over Current Trip
binary_inputs.description: 10ms

binary_inputs.name: SEF/SGF Over Current Trip
binary_inputs.description: 10ms

binary_inputs.name: Sequence Advance
binary_inputs.description: 10ms

binary_inputs.name: Close Isolate
binary_inputs.description: Shows the state of the Trip & Close isolate switches on the control panel

binary_inputs.name: Trip Isolate
binary_inputs.description: Shows the state of the Trip & Close isolate switches on the control panel

binary_inputs.name: Locked
binary_inputs.description: Shows that the ACR is mechanically and electrically locked in the open position. Not supported on the N-Series where it will always be zero.

binary_inputs.name: ACR Memory Data Invalid
binary_inputs.description: Shows that the controller has retrieved the data from the ACR memory. When invalid the switchgear attributes and the gas pressure are zeroed,

binary_inputs.name: Switchgear Connection
binary_inputs.description: Shows that the controller has retrieved the data from the ACR memory. When invalid the switchgear attributes and the gas pressure are zeroed,

binary_inputs.name: SF6 Gas Pressure Low or Invalid
binary_inputs.description: Only set when switchgear is connected and ACR memory data is valid and switchgear type has SF6.

binary_inputs.name: Capacitor Charge Failure
binary_inputs.description: The Trip/Close Capacitors have failed to charge

binary_inputs.name: Mechanism Failure
binary_inputs.description: The switchgear has failed to Trip or Close electrically

binary_inputs.name: Work Tag Trip
binary_inputs.description: One flag only provided because a work tag trip forces lockout. Event time is the time of the pickup.

binary_inputs.name: Auto Changeover Enable
binary_inputs.description: Turn ACO on/off

analog_inputs.name: Protection Group that was in service at the start of the sequence 0=Group A0=Group A 1=Group B1=Group B ... 9=Group J9=Group J
Protection setting selection 0 = Group A 1 = Group B ... 9 = Group J
